meanings.sent1: The putrescible fruit attracted flies with its decaying smell.
meanings.sent2: Leaving food out in the sun makes it putrescible and prone to decay.
meanings.sent3: The putrescible cheese was so smelly, it could be mistaken for a dirty sock.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had a putrescible air about it, as if time itself was decaying within its walls.
meanings.sent5: The putrescible garbage heap behind the restaurant was a breeding ground for pests.

meanings.sent1: The putrescible waste needed to be disposed of quickly before it started decomposing.
meanings.sent2: In the humid climate, even non-putrescible items can become subject to decomposition.
meanings.sent3: The putrescible pumpkin turned into a mushy mess, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: Time is a putrescible force, slowly decomposing all that stands in its path.
meanings.sent5: The putrescible leaves on the forest floor were slowly turning into rich soil.

meanings.definition: Likely to spoil or become foul
meanings.sent1: Leaving milk out in the sun is a sure way to make it putrescible and foul.
meanings.sent2: The warm weather made the food putrescible, causing it to spoil quickly.
meanings.sent3: The putrescible meat in the fridge had a foul odor that made everyone gag.
meanings.sent4: Her putrescible mood was like a dark cloud, spoiling the joy of the party.
meanings.sent5: The putrescible smell coming from the dumpster was enough to make anyone lose their appetite.
